us.phonetic: /n. ˈfrægmənt; v. ˈfrægmɛnt, frægˈmɛnt/, (n. frag′mənt; v. frag′mənt, -ment, frag ment′)

example.eg: I found a fragment of an old dish in the garden.
We found a number scrawled on a fragment of newspaper.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 小片, 片断, 少许

example.eg: The fragment is believed to have been composed by Haydn.
The mineral quickly fragments when placed in water.
The force of the impact fragmented the stone floor.
